thread.title: Hotels will transform Canal St. building vacant since Katrina
thread.title_full: Hotels will transform Canal St. building vacant since Katrina - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: Written by: FOX8Live.com Staff
title: Hotels will transform Canal St. building vacant since Katrina
text:
NEW ORLEANS, LA (WVUE) - A Texas developer will transform a Canal Street building left vacant since hurricane Katrina.
According to our partners at NOLA.com|The Times-Picayune , NewcrestImage has acquired the old UNO building at 1600 Canal Street.
Plans call for turning the building into a hotel, which will be split in two parts. 105 rooms will create a TownePlace Suites by Marriott, targeting extended-stay guests. 78 rooms will create a SpringHill Suites by Marriott, catering to short-stay business and vacation travelers.
NewcrestImage hopes to open its new hotels next year.
Copyright 2015 WVUE.
